titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Daniel Ammen Papers LSC.0811
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Dan Luckenbill, December 1974; machine-readable finding aid created by Alight Tsai and Caroline Cubé.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-17 14:35:08 -0700.

did.abstract: Daniel Ammen (1819-1896) served in the U.S. Navy (1836-1868), was in charge of the Bureau of Yards and Docks and the Bureau of Navigation (1868-78), and served as Secretary of the Isthmian Canal Commission (1872-76). He was also an advocate of a Nicaraguan canal route, a representative of the U.S. at the Interoceanic Canal Congress in Paris (1879), and designer the Ammen ram. The collection contains correspondence, papers, documents, photographs, dueling pistols, and blueprints concerning Admiral Ammen's career in the U.S. Navy, his activities as Secretary of the Isthmian Canal Commission (1872-1876), as representative from the U.S. to the Interoceanic Canal Congress at Paris in 1879, and his various efforts in support of the Nicaraguan canal route. The collection also contains papers relating to the design and construction of the Ammen ram.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Daniel Ammen Papers (Collection 811). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Ammen was born on May 16, 1819; was boyhood friend of Ulysses S. Grant; became a midshipman in 1836; undertook long voyages to China and Japan (1845-47), went on expedition up the Paraguay River (1853-54), sailed on Pacific cruise (1857-60); in Civil War, took part in the attack upon Port Royal in the gunboat Seneca and participated in the bombardment of Fort McAllister in the monitor Patapsco; was called from sea duty through President Grant's influence; in charge of the Bureau of Yards and Docks, and the Bureau of Navigation, 1868-78; was named Secretary of the Isthmian Canal Commission (1872-76), where he became an advocate of a Nicaraguan canal route; represented the U.S. at the Interoceanic Canal Congress in Paris, 1879; designed the Ammen ram, a small coast-defense vessel, one of which, the Katahdin, was built and accepted for service; wrote several books, including The Old Navy and the New (1891); died at Ammendale, near Washington, D.C., on July 11, 1898.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains correspondence, papers, documents, photographs, dueling pistols, and blueprints concerning Admiral Ammen's career in the U.S. Navy and his activities as Secretary of the Isthmian Canal Commission (1872-1876), as representative from the U.S. to the Interoceanic Canal Congress at Paris in 1879, and his various efforts in support of the Nicaraguan canal route. Correspondents include Frederick Douglass, Millard Fillmore, Ulysses S. Grant, Rutherford B. Hayes, Andrew Johnson, Abraham Lincoln, William Tecumseh Sherman, Zachary Taylor, and John Tyler, and the Nicaraguan Canal Association. Also contains papers relating to the design and construction of the Ammen ram, a small coast-defense vessel; a prototype, the Katahdin, was completed and accepted for service on January 4, 1896.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
Arranged in the following series:
Correspondence and memorabilia (Box 1).
Papers concerning the Ammen ram (Box 1).
Papers relating to the Nicaraguan canal route (Box 2-3).
Admiral Daniel Ammen's dueling pistols (Box 4).
Plans (blueprints) of Balsa, Portsmouth, NH Naval Yard (Box 5).

altformavail.head: Online Items Available
altformavail.p: Portions of this collection have been digitized and are available online: Daniel Ammen papers (2 items).

indexentry.name: Fillmore, Millard (president of the U.S.), 1800-1874, document signed.
Grant, Ulysses Simpson (president of the U.S.), 1822-1885, box 1, folder 11 A and documents signed.
Hayes, Rutherford Birchard (president of the U.S.), 1822-1893.
indexentry.ref: Box 1, folder 2 and box 2, folder 1 and Box 6

Lincoln, Abraham (president of the U.S.), 1809-1865, document signed.
Maritime Canal Company of Nicaragua, New York.
Robeson, George Maxwell, 1829-1897. Box 1, folder 21 and documents signed.
Taylor Zachary (president of the U.S.), 1784-1850, document signed.
Tyler, John (president of the U.S.), 1790-1862, document signed.

list.item: Including letters, etc. relating to Admiral Ammen's personal affairs and to his career in the United States Navy.
Some of the letters contain references to the Nicaraguan canal project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stoddart was editor of Lippincott's Magazine. These letters (1889-1891) concern the possibility of publishing portions of Admiral Ammen's memoirs in the magazine. Mention is made of the Nicaragua experiences and letters from General Grant.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Added to Daniel Ammen Papers, Collection 811 (by D. Luckenbill, December 1974).

did.unittitle: Contains 22 documents affirming Admiral Ammen's various naval and other appointments, arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Box 2, folders 19-21 contain some papers, printed government documents and a few clippings.
